reviews.review: Aun queda alguien que no haya disfrutado portal?
Un clásico, para que decir más :v

I want to like this game but the loading screens are just unbelievable. Especially if you've already played the first game. You storm through the tutorial like rooms and hit a loading screen every minute. And have to go through probably 20 loading screens before you reach an interesting room. It's confusing because the game uses elevators constantly but it doesn't load the new level while you're in the elelvator, it literally takes just takes you to a loading screen. After EVERY level. And after EVERY death. The fact that it was released in 2011 is no excuse. That really isn't even that long ago. If they ever re-release this game with smarter ways to load the game, it would be a hard recommendation from me. But as it is, it is simply unaccaptable.

Final Rating - 6.8/10

• Graphics - 8/10
• Story - 5/10
• Music - 9/10
• Replayability - 2/10
• Price Point - 10/10
• Difficulty - 6/10
• Pacing - 8/10


Precise Description

• Graphics - 8/10
Portal 2 was released back in 2011 and its graphics are still phenomenal. The game just looks great. Comparing to its precedessor - Portal 1 - it looks like a completely different game which is a good thing because it really shows all the changes that were made between those two games.

• Story - 5/10
This time I can say that Portal has a story. It's not something wonderful, but it is there. And it's still better than in Portal 1. With its help, we can finally learn more about the environment and the mysterious lab in which we are during the entire series, and the characters itself, including ourselves.

• Music - 9/10
A significant upgrade was made to the sound engine. The music is just a part of normal a game sounds, not the OST only. It changes dynamically according to what's currently happening on a screen. Talking about the music itself - it's great. It really has that 'portalish' feel to it, but in my opinion is somewhat misses the soul of the precedessor. 

• Replayability - 2/10
Like in the previous Portal - the campaign is not replayable. Of course, you can still do that, but everything will remain the same no matter what you do. This time I'm giving 2/10 instead of 1/10 because the game itself is longer and hides more easter eggs which you maybe will find during another run if you still haven't done that in the previous one.

• Price Point - 10/10
It's just great. The game is worth its price. Nothing to add.

• Difficulty - 6/10
The game can be difficult for some players. Fortunetely, all game mechanics are well explained and the speed of difficulty level getting higher is decent. There's no such things as sudden changes in the difficulty level.

• Pacing - 8/10
Is good, the progression of the game is decent and doesn't take forever to get interesting. But I have to say that in some places it is too fast and gives me the feel that the part of the plot is rushed and could be expanded a bit more.


Summary
• Portal 2, like its precedessor, is a wonderful game. One of the best puzzle games out there, a must have in your Steam Library. If you still haven't tried it yet, just do it. I bet it will remind you of those good old times when Valve was still making great SinglePlayer games. It's also a fun to play and relaxing game, so you're for sure gonna have a good time with it.
Love this game!

Portal 2 is an amazing game with a great and humorous story and fun co-op campaign. The visuals are pretty good and some of the puzzles can be pretty challenging. The most fun part in my opinion is meeting up with people you don't know while playing co-op. Some people online can be pretty rude but most of them are really nice people. There's also the puzzle maker which allows you to make your own levels and share them with the world for others to play. so far i have over 600 hours when I'm writing this updated review and I still plan on playing more too. So over all this game is amazing and fun and I hope to also see more random people playing co-op coustom levels too.

The greatest game of all time. I literally have no flaws with this game, everything was perfect to me. The simplistic yet engaging story, the fantastic characters. The dialogue is some of the best from any game from any generation, which is supported by an outstanding cast of voice actors. This is Valve at their best.

Haber que puedo decir de esta belleza, el sistema de puzzles es de los mejores, sus ambientes Post-apocalipticos entre los restos de Aperture y la naturaleza renaciendo entre las cenizas son increibles, la rivalidad entre nuestros protagonistas contra el antagonista son muy notables, los easter-eggs aun que sean pocos son muy buenos para dejar suspenso de que fue lo que paso antes de que Aperture cerrara y cual era la relacion entre Chell y los antiguos integrantes de Aperture, que mas decir de su increible historia y el increible reto mental que algunos o la mayoria de los niveles otorgan, el sistema online es bueno para  divertirte entre tu y tu compañero.

I have played the game for over 100 hours and I have to say that this might be one of the best puzzle games of the decade. The graphics (especially for being made in 2012) are high quality, the mechanics are smooth, and the game is very well optimized. It is playable on almost any computer from the past 5 years. I can’t forget overlook the amazing storyline this game provides (although I would recommend you play the first Portal for the full storyline), and the well developed maps and mods made by one of the least toxic game communities out there. This is a game that I recommend to nearly every person willing to spend money on Steam.
